review_title: Great Potential For Making A Huge Difference Across the Continuum of Care
pros: Staff is very friendly and supportive. There is great teamwork dedicated to helping customers provide the highest quality, cost effective, person-centered care.
cons: The senior leadership team struggles to keep up with the challenges of the rapidly changing healthcare environment. The organization’s innovation is frequently too narrowly focused for the system-wide effects of new processes to be understood and recognized.

review_title: Not run well, unable to complete job
pros: Working remotely was great for me.
cons: Poor leadership was the driving force for me to leave before we launched our program.

pros: Great Benefits! Fun key people. That's it basically.  Please refer to cons as they outweigh the pros. It's a job.
cons: Poorly ran. Constant changes. Still financially unstable. Mis hiring and mis management. Egos on egos.  Overload their employees when they don't have enough people to cover roles. High turnover and fire rate.

pros: The rank and file employees are all awesome, dedicated people. Somehow they keep hiring super-qualified and competent individuals. Good benefits. Great location in DC.
cons: Poor pay relative to experience, chaotic management, directionless, certain departments and roles have zero development opportunity

pros: Office location in downtown DC is nice.  Some benefits generous.
cons: The bloated IT area has hijacked the rest of the company, turning CHAP into a software development house that only dabbles in healthcare. Management has gone through many iterations but hasn't yet found the formula to be effective and keep the business financially viable.  Concerns about long-term future.

job_title: Business Analyst and Quality Assurance in Washington, DC
pros: Nice work environment and caring staff
cons: Poor managment and slow career growth
